image.altText: A girl looking at her phone

props.synopsis: Young people say racist commentary on social media makes them feel unsafe, as a report calls for a systemic overhaul to address the rampant racism experienced by young Territorians.

title.children: Cruel vitriol on Alice Springs social media pages leaves young people feeling frightened and vulnerable

image.altText: A group of people, some wearing kiffeyeh and some with Palestine flags, stand smiling outside NSW court.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian events for Sunday and Monday in Sydney will go ahead, after both NSW Police and organisers reached a late agreement in the background of a Supreme Court hearing.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events in Sydney's CBD on Sunday and Monday to go ahead after last-minute agreement with police

image.altText: Black and white image woman holding an ice cream next to a scruffy puppet named Agro

props.synopsis: Former TV presenter Fiona MacDonald, best known for her work on the children's program Wombat and game show It's a Knockout, has died aged 67.

title.children: Former children's TV host Fiona MacDonald announces own passing on social media after tough journey with disease

image.altText: A screenshot of Penny Wong giving a press conference.

props.synopsis: After the federal government announced another budget surplus, Jacqui Lambie had a blunt assessment: "Nobody gives a stuff." It shows how far the political discourse has moved in recent years.

title.children: After dozens of plane seats sat empty, the government seems close to begging people to come home

image.altText: Joe Daniher of the Lions during the AFL grand final, looking up at the crowd

props.synopsis: Brisbane forward Joe Daniher has announced his retirement from the AFL, just days after helping the Lions win the grand final.

title.children: Lions premiership star Joe Daniher announces retirement

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: A letter seen by the ABC shows the Northern Territory's Legal Aid Commission is planning to cut critical legal services from January next year due to a lack of funding.

title.children: Legal Aid NT warns it will stop taking on adult criminal matters in 2025 due to lack of funding

image.altText: A Northern Territory police vehicle in Katherine.

props.synopsis: NT police have charged a 36-year-old man with the domestic violence-related murder of a 22-year-old woman in Katherine.

title.children: Man charged with murdering his 22-year-old partner in NT town

image.altText: Jayson Gillham sits on a step outside in a professional portrait photo

props.synopsis: Jayson Gillham files a statement of claim in Federal Court after the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra cancelled one of his performances over comments he made on stage about the war in Gaza.

title.children: Pianist launches legal action against Melbourne Symphony Orchestra over Gaza comments controversy

image.altText: A bearded firefighter in shadow at night stands in front of a damaged building.

props.synopsis: Israel's military warns people to evacuate a city and other communities in southern Lebanon, signalling it may widen its ground operation in addition to strikes targeting the Hezbollah militant group.

title.children: Israel warns south Lebanon communities to evacuate, signalling wider offensive

image.altText: A hydrogen container with a warning sign about flammable gas.

props.synopsis: A project held up as a flagship for Australia's fledgling green hydrogen industry loses its biggest backer as Origin Energy abandons plans for the fuel.

title.children: Hopes for green hydrogen fading as energy giant Origin walks away from flagship project

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Days before Christmas, Maurine's retirement village threatened her with eviction. Advocates say village operators have an incentive to churn residents to maximise revenue from exit fees.

title.children: The tactics retirement villages use to churn residents and maximise profits

image.altText: A woman poses for a person taking a photo with a Swiss flag with the alps in the background.

props.synopsis: The increasing rate of glacier melt has meant Switzerland's border with Italy has been redrawn — here's why, and how.

title.children: Climate change is changing the borders of countries — just ask Switzerland

image.altText: A close up image of Adam Bandt at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens leader deflects questions about whether he will discipline his WA senator Dorinda Cox, following claims of bullying in her office.

title.children: Greens leader Adam Bandt cites privacy concerns in tense press conference, after WA senator accused of bullying office staff

image.altText: Flames burn on the outside of a multi-storey building as black smoke rises from the scene

props.synopsis: Typhoon Krathon has killed two people and injured more than 100 others in Taiwan, after displacing 5,000 in the Philippines earlier in the week.

title.children: Nine people killed in hospital fire in Taiwan as typhoon sweeps across the country

image.altText: A campaign placard.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris needs to win Michigan, but the Republican strategy to swing the state is stronger than you might think.

title.children: 'They will vote Trump': The troubling signs for Democrats in a state Kamala Harris must win

image.altText: Tony Armstrong wearing a white T shirt and a denim jacket.

props.synopsis: Barely 24 hours after the ABC committed to a suite of actions to stamp out racism experienced by their First Nations and culturally and linguistically diverse staff, the broadcaster's Director News was again publicly calling it out.

title.children: Trolling of Tony Armstrong shows exactly why action is needed to stamp out racism at the ABC and beyond

image.altText: Two dingoes walking through the wide open cage

props.synopsis: The Shire of Murchison says it's "unlikely" two popular pet dingoes on farmstay Wooleen Station were shot under its bounty system.

title.children: Council defends dingo bounty after disappearance of two 'pets' helping station's conservation effort

image.altText: A female Peregrine falcon keeps her new chicks warm.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's famous peregrine falcons are giving their live stream followers something to squawk about, with two tiny chicks hatching and another on the way.

title.children: A big day for 'bird nerds' as falcon chicks seen hatching in real-time

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: The defamation trial between Opposition Leader John Pesutto and ousted Liberal MP Moira Deeming has heard a secret recording taken by Ms Deeming where she denied being transphobic or homophobic in a meeting with senior Liberals.

title.children: Another secret recording aired in Deeming-Pesutto defamation trial – this time made by Moira Deeming

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: In evidence in her civil lawsuit against the State of Victoria, lawyer turned police informer Nicola Gobbo says Victoria Police made frequent threats to strip her children from her custody if she did not comply with their orders.

title.children: 'I'm tired and broken': Nicola Gobbo details life in limbo and under police control in court

image.altText: Brightly coloured cells and neurons show the structure of a fruit fly brain that has been mapped for the first time.

props.synopsis: The research sought to decipher how brains are wired and the signals underlying healthy brain functions. It also could pave the way for mapping the brains of other species.

title.children: Scientists have mapped a fruit fly's brain. It's a neurobiological milestone

image.altText: Nina Korbe wears a red velvet formal gown with a black silk cape and sings into a microphone on stage with a broad smile.

props.synopsis: With an aim to advance equality in the music industry, winners at this year's Australian Women in Music Awards have been celebrated in Brisbane.

title.children: Dame Joan Sutherland and 'Little Pattie' Amphlett among the trailblazers recognised at Australian Women in Music Awards

image.altText: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran's "Axis of Resistance" is dedicated to countering US and Israeli influence in the Middle East. Here's a look at the group's key players and their roles in the current conflict.

title.children: What is Iran's so-called Axis of Resistance?

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: SA's Police Commissioner Grant Stevens and his wife Emma tell a court of their pain after their 'vibrant' and 'fun-loving' son Charlie was killed in a crash while at Schoolies celebrations last year.

title.children: Losing youngest son has 'taken so much of the colour out of our lives', SA Police Commissioner tells court

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders.

props.synopsis: Canberra Raiders star player Josh Papalii is expected to be charged after allegedly throwing glasses and verbally abusing staff at the Raiders Gungahlin club last month, and threatening and intimidating police when they told him to leave.

title.children: Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii to be charged over alleged Mad Monday incident

image.altText: Ashley Marsters in action for the Wallaroos

props.synopsis: Ashley Marsters will tie the record set by Liz Patu by becoming the equal most-capped Australian women's Test player when she takes the field against South Africa this weekend.

title.children: Wallaroos eyeing first Test win over South Africa in a decade in star's record-setting appearance

image.altText: Praveen Jayawickrama celebrates a Test wicket

props.synopsis: A failure to report an approach to fix international matches has landed Sri Lankan spinner Praveen Jayawickrama in big trouble with the ICC.

title.children: Sri Lankan spinner banned from all forms of cricket for a year after breaching anti-corruption code

image.altText: Building is half torn down.

props.synopsis: The key front-line Ukrainian town of Vuhledar has spent the last two years fighting tooth and nail to resist repeated attacks from Russia. Now, Moscow's soldiers have taken complete control. What does this mean?

title.children: In a significant victory, Russia has taken the Ukrainian town of Vuhledar after two years of resistance

image.altText: A large, ornate cabinet in an art gallery.

props.synopsis: The final work of master craftsman Geoff Hannah was badly damaged during the devastating Lismore floods in 2022. Now that an insurance dispute has been resolved, work to restore the piece can finally get underway.

title.children: Painstaking restoration set to begin on $1m cabinet so beautiful it makes people weep

image.altText: Palestinian flags at a pro-Palestine rally.

props.synopsis: Federal and state authorities have urged pro-Palestinian protesters to reconsider plans to hold rallies on the first anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack, with the SA premier describing a proposed demonstration as "grossly irresponsible" and "insensitive" to the Jewish community.

title.children: 'Grossly irresponsible' for pro-Palestine protests on anniversary of Hamas terrorist attack, SA Premier says

image.altText: A mobile screen with a blurred image of a person

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has called for urgent action to prevent the personal data of Australia's national security personnel being on-sold to foreign actors after a new report exposed a blackmail risk.

title.children: Your sensitive personal data is shared almost 500 times a day by the online ad industry

image.altText: A man walks with his head slightly down as he leaves a court house.

props.synopsis: Singapore's former transport minister has been sentenced to 12 months jail over accepting gifts including F1 tickets, English Premier League tickets, and a private jet ride.

title.children: A private jet trip and English Premier League tickets lands Singapore ex-minister in jail

image.altText: Holly from Fat Bear Week

props.synopsis: With Alaska's bears fat, fluffy and stuffed full of salmon, Fat Bear Week is upon us.

title.children: The internet's beloved Fat Bear Week returns after deadly attack delayed reveal
